title: Gravitational field - explain constant value of g

content.prompt: Why can the gravitational field strength g near Earth’s surface be approximated as constant?

choices.label: Because g is a fundamental constant of nature and has the same value everywhere.
Because the field strength is proportional to the universal gravitational constant, G.
Because distance scales near Earth’s surface are very small compared to Earth’s radius.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
